snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry extended his stay for another day as he met with his Iranian counterpart on Wednesday night for what diplomats said could be a series of pivotal sessions.
abstract: Pres Obama reportedly instructed Sec of State John Kerry and Energy Sec Ernest J Moniz to ignore approaching deadline in Iran nuclear talks and to indicate that United States is ready to walk away from talks, leaving sanctions in place; tactic is designed to change dynamic of talks, relieving American officials of deadline pressure and convincing Iran that America is not more invested in deal than they are.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and DAVID E. SANGER
byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry extended his stay for another day as he met with his Iranian counterpart on Wednesday night for what diplomats said could be a series of pivotal sessions.

headline.main: Obama Told Iran Nuclear Negotiators to Disregard Deadline in 11th Hour
headline.print_headline: Obama Told Negotiators to Disregard Deadline in Last Days of Iran Talks
